COSMOSformat

Class V1Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • COSMOSformat.COSMOScontentFormat
      • COSMOSformat.V1Component

  • public class V1Component
extends COSMOScontentFormat
    This class extends the COSMOScontentFormat base class to define a V1 record. It defines methods to parse the V1 data array, build a new V1 component from V1 processing results, and convert the V1 component into text for writing out to file.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class COSMOSformat.COSMOScontentFormat

    • Constructor Detail

      • V1Component

        public V1Component(java.lang.String procType)
        Use this constructor when the V1 component is read in from a file and filled in with the loadComponent method. In this case, there is no parentV0 associated with this V1
        Parameters:
        procType - process level indicator (i.e. "V1")

      • V1Component

        public V1Component(java.lang.String procType,
                   V0Component pV0)
        Use this constructor when the V1 component is created from processing done on a V0 component. In this case, the contents of V1 are initialized to the V0 values and updated during the processing.
        Parameters:
        procType - process level indicator (i.e. "V1")
        pV0 - reference to the parent V0Component

    • Method Detail

      • parseDataSection

        public int parseDataSection(int startLine,
                            java.lang.String[] infile)
                     throws FormatException
        This method defines the steps for parsing a V1 data record, which contains a floating point data array.
        Overrides:
        parseDataSection in class COSMOScontentFormat
        Parameters:
        startLine - line number for the start of the data section
        infile - contents of the input file, one string per line
        Returns:
        updated line number now pointing to first line after data section
        Throws:
        FormatException - if unable to extract format information or to convert text values to numeric

        Getter for the length of the data array

        public double[] getDataArray()
        Getter for a copy of the data array reference. Used to access the entire array during data processing.

      • getRealValue

        public double getRealValue(int index)

      • getIntValue

        public int getIntValue(int index)

      • buildV1

        public void buildV1(V1Process inVvals)
             throws SmException,
                    FormatException
        This method builds the V1 component from the V1 process object, picking up the data array and updating header parameters and format lines. Once in this method, the V1Process object is no longer needed and its array is transferred to the V1Component object.
        Parameters:
        inVvals - the V1Process object
        Throws:
        SmException - if unable to access the header values
        FormatException - if unable to format the numeric values to text

      • buildNewDataFormatLine

        public void buildNewDataFormatLine(java.lang.String units,
                                   int unitsCode)
                            throws SmException
        This method creates a new data format line for the V1 component data array. It calculates the time based on the number of data values and delta t and gets the physical units from the configuration file.
        Parameters:
        units - the numeric code for the type of units, COSMOS table 2
        unitsCode - code containing the type of units (cm, cm/sec, etc.)
        Throws:
        SmException - if unable to access values in the headers

      • getDataFormatLine

        public java.lang.String getDataFormatLine()
        Getter for the data format line
        Returns:
        the data format line

      • VrecToText

        public java.lang.String[] VrecToText()
        This method converts the V1 component stored in memory into its text format for writing to a file.
        Overrides:
        VrecToText in class COSMOScontentFormat
        Returns:
        a text array with the V1 component in COSMOS format for a file

      • updateArray

        public java.lang.String updateArray(double[] inArray,
                                    java.time.ZonedDateTime newStartTime,
                                    int startcount,
                                    int endcount)
                             throws SmException,
                                    FormatException
        This method is used by the GUI review tool during the trim process. After an uncorrected acceleration array is trimmed, the array is updated and new statistics calculated. Line 10(11) of the text header is updated with the current time and the new statistics, and the data format line is also updated.
        Parameters:
        inArray - trimmed uncorrected acceleration array. This array is modified if a non-zero mean is calculated (in this case the mean will be removed from the array).
        newStartTime - ZonedDateTime-formatted updated record start time
        startcount - number of points removed from the beginning of the array
        endcount - number of points removed from the end of the array
        Returns:
        the original data format line, before the trim (optional, for debug)
        Throws:
        SmException - if unable to update the array
        FormatException - if error occurs building the data format line
